issues.description: The problem statement specifies CRUD endpoints under "/persons" (e.g., POST /persons, GET /persons), but the solution’s PersonResource maps all endpoints to "/people". This mismatch in resource paths will confuse students about which URI to use.
issues.suggested_fix: Change all mappings in PersonResource from "people" to "persons", e.g. use @GetMapping("persons"), @PostMapping("persons"), etc., to match the problem specification.

issues.description: Within the solution’s client-side PersonController, URIs are used inconsistently: addPerson/updatePerson post to "people", but deletePerson and getAllPersons use "persons". This inner inconsistency will break client-server communication and confuse students.
issues.suggested_fix: Use the same base path for all HTTP calls in PersonController (either always "people" or always "persons"). For example, if you choose "/persons", update the POST and PUT URIs to ".uri(\"persons\")" and ".uri(\"persons/" + person.getId() + "\")".

issues.description: The problem statement specifies that the CRUD endpoints should be under the URI path "/persons" (e.g., POST /persons, GET /persons, etc.), but the Solution Repository’s PersonResource defines those endpoints under "/people" (@GetMapping("people"), @PostMapping("people"), etc.). This mismatch between “persons” and “people” breaks the intended mapping of requirements to implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the path segments in PersonResource from "people" to "persons" for all CRUD mappings so they match the problem specification (POST /persons, GET /persons, PUT /persons/{id}, DELETE /persons/{id}).

issues.description: Within the Solution Repository’s PersonController, the HTTP request URIs are inconsistently mixed: POST and PUT use "people" (.uri("people")), while DELETE and GET use "persons" (.uri("persons/..."), .path("persons")). This inconsistent naming of the same resource will confuse students about which endpoint to call.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the resource path in PersonController so that all CRUD operations use the same segment—either consistently "people" or "persons"—to avoid confusion.
